solution_line_template: Santana has {brothers_bday_october} + {brothers_bday_november} + {brothers_bday_december} = <<{brothers_bday_october}+{brothers_bday_november}+{brothers_bday_december}={brothers_bday_second_half}>>{brothers_bday_second_half} brothers with birthdays in the second half of the year.

She has {total_brothers} brothers - {brothers_bday_second_half} brothers = <<{total_brothers}-{brothers_bday_second_half}={brothers_bday_first_half}>>{brothers_bday_first_half} brothers with birthdays in the first half of the year.

Altogether, she has to buy {brothers_bday_second_half} + {total_brothers} = <<{brothers_bday_second_half}+{total_brothers}={presents_second_half}>>{presents_second_half} presents in the second half of the year.

Therefore, she has to buy {presents_second_half} - {brothers_bday_first_half} = <<{presents_second_half}-{brothers_bday_first_half}={more_presents_second_half}>>{more_presents_second_half} more presents in the second half of the year.
